markdown.markdown:
SELECTED RESEARCH & ANALYSIS

Research Portfolio

A curated selection of advanced analytics projects demonstrating statistical rigor, predictive modeling, and strategic data-driven insights across diverse domains.

::: {.grid} ::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
Statistical Significance Testing & Causal Analysis
Quantified the effectiveness of matching grant interventions on charitable donation behavior. Applied rigorous hypothesis testing and multivariate regression to isolate treatment effects across demographic segments. **Key Findings:** - Matching grant treatment: +21.2% average donation lift - Statistical significance: p = 0.045 (OLS regression) - Effect persists after controlling for demographics **Methodology:** T-tests, Multiple Linear Regression, Statistical Inference **Scale:** 4,000+ donor records with experimental treatment assignment [Explore Analysis →](/projects/project1/) ::: ::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6} ### [02 — Patent Holdings Prediction](/projects/project2/)
Generalized Linear Modeling & Count Regression
Developed predictive model for patent portfolio composition across geographic and demographic dimensions. Implemented Poisson regression to handle count-based outcome with overdispersion. **Key Findings:** - Regional variation accounts for 34% of model variance - Age exhibits non-linear relationship with patent holdings - Customer status significant predictor (p < 0.01) **Methodology:** Poisson Regression, EDA, Distribution Analysis **Scale:** Patent registry data across multiple regions [Explore Analysis →](/projects/project2/) ::: ::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6} ### [03 — Consumer Preference Modeling](/projects/project3/)
Conjoint Analysis & Discrete Choice Modeling
Decomposed consumer preferences for product attributes through factorial experimental design. Identified price elasticity, feature importance weights, and willingness-to-pay across segments. **Key Findings:** - Price elasticity: -1.8 (moderately elastic) - Attribute importance ranking via utility weights - Segment-specific preference heterogeneity **Methodology:** Conjoint Analysis, Preference Estimation **Scale:** Consumer choice experiments, 2,000+ respondents [Explore Analysis →](/projects/project3/) ::: ::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6} ### [04 — Business Drivers Analysis](/projects/project4/)
Key Driver Regression & Impact Assessment
Isolated primary performance drivers through multi-stage regression analysis. Quantified relative contribution of operational variables to outcome metrics using driver-based decomposition. **Key Findings:** - Top 3 drivers account for 68% of outcome variance - Driver interaction effects identified and modeled - Actionable prioritization for resource allocation **Methodology:** Key Driver Regression, Sensitivity Analysis **Scale:** Multi-dimensional operational dataset [Explore Analysis →](/projects/project4/) ::: ::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6} ### [05 — Multi-Source Data Integration](/projects/Project5/)
Comparative EDA & Statistical Summaries
Synthesized exploratory analysis across three curated datasets to identify structural patterns, distributions, and inter-variable relationships. Applied statistical tests for normality, correlation, and group differences. **Key Findings:** - Comprehensive descriptive statistics and visualizations - Distribution characteristics (skewness, kurtosis) - Comparative patterns across datasets **Methodology:** EDA, Distribution Analysis, Statistical Summaries **Datasets:** Iris Measurements, Palmer Penguins, Yogurt Preferences [Explore Analysis →](/projects/Project5/) ::: ::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6} ### [06 — Qualcomm Strategic Analysis](/projects/project6/)
Enterprise Strategic Analysis & Financial Modeling
Comprehensive organizational assessment integrating market intelligence, financial performance analysis, and operational metrics. Developed actionable recommendations for strategic positioning and performance optimization. **Key Deliverables:** - Executive presentation with strategic recommendations - Detailed financial and operational analysis - Competitive benchmarking and market positioning **Methodology:** Strategic Analysis, Financial Modeling, Comparative Benchmarking **Scope:** Multi-dimensional organizational and market review [Explore Analysis →](/projects/project6/) ::: ::: color: #1a1a1a; } [data-bs-theme="dark"] .grid > div strong { color: #ffffff; } .grid > div p { color: #555; font-size: 1rem; line-height: 1.6; margin-bottom: 1rem; } [data-bs-theme="dark"] .grid > div p { color: #d0d0d0; } .grid a[href$="/"] { display: inline-block; margin-top: 1rem; font-weight: 600; color: #2980b9; transition: all 0.2s ease; } .grid a[href$="/"]::after { content: ""; display: inline-block; margin-left: 0.3rem; } .grid a[href$="/"]:hover { color: #1a5fa0; text-decoration: none; }
